SENT.plain: Two new sublines of Djungarian hamster cells DM-15CHR-1/1 and DM-15CHR-1/5 which are 170--190-fold resistant to colchicine as compared to the initial DM-15 cells have been described
Drug resistance of these cells is unstable: in nonselective conditions the trait is lost at a rate approximately 2.10(-2) per cell per generation

All cells of the two independently derived clonal sublines have the same karyotypic alteration: an additional marker chromosome, the derivative of chromosome 4 carrying homogeneously colored region (HCR) in the long arm
The size of HCR varies in different cells
Its average length is about 4--5% of the total length of all chromosomes
In some cells circular chromosomes or double-minutes were found in addition to the marker chromosome
They consist of the material similar to that of HCR
These data suggest that colchicine-resistance is associated with gene amplification
